availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel B. Patterson (Bracken County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Ohio native. Married to Frances Patterson. Father of Maud S. Patterson. Served as a private and quartermaster in the 16th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from January 9, 1862, to March 25, 1863. Farmer in Bracken County in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Augusta, p. 267A.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Louisiana, Orleans Parish, New Orleans. p. 348C.
Legislative Document, No. 14: Report and Testimony in the Contested Election Case of Reynolds Against Stroube, Made to the House of Representatives, December 15, 1865 (Frankfort, KY: State Printing Office, 1866), 6.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 926-27.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 941.
